Kenaikan Iuran BPJS Dianggap Perlu Ditinjau Ulang
02 Nov 2019, 13:03 by Dwi Andayani
Jakarta - Presiden Joko Widodo (Jokowi) resmi menaikkan iuran BPJS Kesehatan untuk Peserta Bukan Penerima Upah (PBPU) dan Bukan Pekerja. Kenaikan iuran ini dinilai perlu ditinjau ulang.
"Kami sangat mengharapkan supaya kenaikan iuran BPJS ini ditinjau ulang," ujar anggota Komisi IX fraksi PKS DPR RI, Kirniasih Mufidayati, dalam diskusi Polemik Trijaya 'BPJS Kesehatan, Kezzeel Tapi Butuh' di Ibis Tamarin, Jl KH Wahid Hasyim, Jakarta Pusat, Sabtu (2/11/2019).
Mufida mengatakan Komisi IX DPR sebelumnya telah rapat gabungan bersama komisi lain dan beberapa lembaga, termasuk BPJS pada 2 September 2019.
Dia menyebut pada kesempatan itu Komisi IX menolak rencana pemerintah untuk menaikan harga iuran kesehatan.
"Komisi IX dan Komisi XI menolak rencana pemerintah untuk menaikkan premi JKN untuk peserta bukan penerima upah atau PBPU dan bukan pekerja atau BP kelas 3," kata Mufida.
Dia juga meminta BPJS menyelesaikan data cleansing serta mencari alternatif lain selain menaikan iuran. "Sampai data cleansing itu diselesaikan dan mengharapkan pemerintah dapat mencari cara lain dalam menanggulangi defisit dana jaminan sosial atau BPJS Kesehatan," kata Mufida.
Sementara itu, Founder Cikini Study Teddy M Yamin mengatakan waktu kenaikan jumlah iuran BPJS ini kurang tepat. Hal ini karena banyak kenaikan harga-harga lain dalam kebutuhan sehari-hari.
"Timingnya kurang tepat, di tengah kebutuhan hidup rakyat yang sedang disergap dengan berbagai kenaikan. Jangan lihat ke atas, tapi lihat di bawah," kata Teddy.
"Bukan hanya BPJS, biaya listrik juga naik listrik dan biaya hidup juga kebutuhan pokok naik. Kalau di sebuah kampung saja untuk naikkan 10% saja repot," sambungnya.

The Increase in BPJS Contributions is Considered Needed to Be Reviewed
02 Nov 2019, 13:03 by Dwi Andayani
Jakarta - President Joko Widodo (Jokowi) officially raised the BPJS Health fees for Non Wage Recipients (PBPU) and Non-Workers. This increase in fees is deemed necessary to be reviewed.
"We really hope that this increase in BPJS contributions will be reviewed," said Commission IX member of the DPR RI PKS faction, Kirniasih Mufidayati, in a Trijaya Polemic discussion 'Health BPJS, Kezzeel But Need' at Ibis Tamarin, Jl KH Wahid Hasyim, Central Jakarta, Saturday (2/11/2019).
Mufida said the DPR's Commission IX had previously been a joint meeting with other commissions and several institutions, including BPJS on September 2, 2019.
He said on that occasion Commission IX rejected the government's plan to raise the price of health contributions.
"Commission IX and Commission XI reject the government's plan to raise JKN premiums for participants not receiving wages or PBPU and not workers or BP class 3," said Mufida.
He also asked BPJS to complete data cleansing and look for alternatives to raising fees. "Until the cleansing data is completed and hope the government can find other ways to overcome the social security fund deficit or BPJS Health," said Mufida.
Meanwhile, Cikini Study Founder Teddy M Yamin said the timing of the increase in the amount of BPJS contributions was not right. This is because many other prices increase in daily necessities.
"The timing is not right, in the midst of people's life needs that are being ambushed with various increases. Don't look up, but look below," Teddy said.
"Not only BPJS, electricity costs also increase electricity and living costs as well as basic needs rise. If in a village alone to raise 10% is just a hassle," he continued.
